chargeHist.descr: Threat to a Law Enforcement Officer
Threat to a Law Enforcement Officer
Threat to a Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
The defendant David A. Marin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Threat to a Law Enforcement Officer, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.203(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

charges.descr: Threat to a Law Enforcement Officer

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David A. Marin

records.addlTxt: Judgment & Certification of Debt returned as undeliverable

9:54 AM Cases called: 22TR2168, 22CF457, 22CF716 & 22CM318 Defendant David A. Marin in court.  Attorney Erika Amundson in court for David A. Marin.  Attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for State of Wisconsin. There is an agreement. Victim/Witness statute complied with. 

Defendant enters a no contest plea to an amended Count 1 in 22CF457: Operate a Motor Vehicle without Owner's consent without the repeater. 
Defendant enters a no contest plea to an amended Count 1 in 22CF716: Threat to a Law Enforcement Officer without the repeater.
Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Court accepts plea and finds the defendant guilty. 

Court orders:
2 years Probation sentence withheld with conditions on each count concurrent.

Conditions of Probation:
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. 
AODA and follow through with recommendations. 
90 days jail with Huber on Count 1 in 22CF716 only; all stayed pending further order of the court. 
court costs and surcharges.

Anything else, including all of 22CM318 and 22TR2168, is ordered dismissed and read in. 

Jail credit if revoked from Probation
22CF457 - 2 days
22CF716 - 2 days
Notice of Assignment of Judge - Return to Sender, No Such Number, Unable to Forward

records.addlTxt:
Conditions:

(11:28 AM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant David A. Marin appeared by video, in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail. Attorney Ryan Glenn Kohler appeared by video for David A. Marin.
Defendant waives formal reading of the complaint and time limits for preliminary hearing.
State notes the defendant has other open pending cases and requests all be scheduled for the same date and time.
Court notes the defendant will need to address the prelim or waiver at next hearing.
Hearing scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 10:15 am in Branch 5.

Conditions:
No contact with D.J. unless in their official capacity.
